SEARCH

Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322

package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322
RFC 5322 Internet Message Format parsing and generation.

This package implements RFC 5322 (Internet Message Format), providing parsing and generation of email message headers and structure.

Key Components

  • EmailAddressParser - Parses email address lists (From, To, Cc, Bcc, etc.)
  • MessageDateTimeFormatter - Formats and parses RFC 5322 date-time values
  • MessageParser - Parses complete email messages
  • MessageHandler - Callback interface for parsed message parts
  • EmailAddress - Represents an email address
  • GroupEmailAddress - Represents an email group address
  • MessageIDParser - Parses Message-ID and References headers

Address Format

Supported address formats include:

  • Simple addresses: user@example.com
  • Named addresses: "Display Name" <user@example.com>
  • Groups: Group Name: addr1@ex.com, addr2@ex.com;

Date Format

RFC 5322 date-time format: 

Thu, 13 Feb 2020 14:30:00 +0000

The parser is lenient and handles common variations found in real-world email messages.

Usage

This package is used internally by the mail server packages for parsing and generating email message headers.

Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Class
    Description
    EmailAddress
    This class represents an Internet email address using the syntax of RFC 5322.
    EmailAddressParser
    High-performance RFC 5322 compliant email address parser.
    GroupEmailAddress
    This class represents an Internet group email address using the syntax of RFC 5322.
    MessageDateTimeFormatter
    RFC 5322 compliant date-time formatter for email headers.
    MessageHandler
    Receive notification of the logical content of an RFC 5322 email message.
    MessageIDParser
    Parser for RFC 5322 Message-ID lists.
    MessageParser
    A parser for RFC 5322 email messages.
    ObsoleteParserUtils
    Utility class for parsing obsolete email formats from legacy RFCs.
    ObsoleteStructureType
    Types of obsolete but recoverable message structures that may be detected during parsing.
